title: Better calendar view
body: An actual calendar, not just a long list.

title: Create new "dashboard"
body:
The first page you see on login. 

Should answer the questions: 
- is how I am feeling today normal for me, where 
- where am i in my cycle
- when is my next period
- and the ones after that?

title: Replace custom POW! Angels code with a service
body:
I think it stands between Podia and Patreon.

Patreon is very much about rewards, but could of course not promise much at each tire. It is branded Patreon. This could be both seen as good and bad.

Podia is a membership and course platform.

Both will let med do public and Angel only content. However, with Podia, I could also develop small courses and digital downloads only the Angels would get access to. And I think that sort of content could be the reward they get.

Also, mention the service I will use for the info/updates newsletter.

title: Set up payment
body:
The user should be able to pay monthly or yearly for POW!

It should also be possible to pay for lifetime access.

title: Why is unknown pages not redirected to the gatsby 404 page
Prediction engine
body:
I need an ok prediction engine that lets the user know what they have tagged around the same time in their cycle before. This could be to check if feeling, for example, exhausted is normal for them or not at that time in their cycle.

The current code can be found here https://github.com/raae/pow-app/blob/master/src/store/useCycle/utils.js.

I find each cycle by checking for menstruation tags 14 days or more apart. This lets users skip logging their menstruation a day without indicating a new cycle.

Then i add the tags from each day in the cycle to a dictionary with the key being days since the first day in the cycle.

The problem with this is that cycles are not usually exactly the same length. So the cycles should be normalized in some way. As something happening two days before the next menstruation in one cycle might not even show up if the average cycle is two days shorter.

A form that adds them to a MailChimp list maybe? 

Information about why the app is free, the same as on the marketing page.

title: App design (flow and main user tasks)
body:
When is my next period? 
And a simple way to find the next ones as well.

Is what I am feeling today normal for me?
Or is it something other than my hormones and I need to take action?

Quickly log symptom X!

<!---
@huboard:{"order":1.9991002499450103}
-->

title: Marketing site (and marketing in general)
body:
I would like a similar design to https://usefathom.com. 

* Simple and clean. 
* Straight to the point
  * Menstruation is menstruation, not "that time of the month" etc.
* Gender-neutral language, illustrations, and design
  * Both because there are some who do not identify as women who menstruate, and also because I am sick of "girly, girly" language/design in menstrual apps.
* I quite like red as the main color, but could use some accent colors to tone it down a notch.
